comments:
3.0 RC1

If someone keeps a reference to a configuration element from a bundle that has
already been installed, we end up having NPEs (since we assume there is a Bundle
corresponding to CE's namespace).

Of course, a client should not keep holding to a registry object when the
corresponding bundle is already gone (we send deltas for that), but I believe we
should do the proper testing and fail with
Core/IllegalState/AssertionFailedExceptions instead.

Here is (an excerpt of) the stack trace for the NPE I got after uninstalling a
bundle.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElement.java:117)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension(ConfigurationElement.java:113)
...
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 62123 ***
